intro: Psoralea bituminosa var. rotundata, commonly known as the roundleaf psoralea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its seed pods are distinctive, being smooth and somewhat inflated, and the seeds are dispersed by wind. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its adaptability and unique morphological features.
